alert.note: Alert for Cass (North Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks (Northeastern North Dakota and Northwestern Minnesota)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 10 at 8:39PM CDT until May 15 at 10:00AM CDT by NWS Eastern ND and Grand Forks
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at Drayton affecting Walsh, Marshall, Pembina and Kittson Counties. Red River of the North at Wahpeton affecting Richland and Wilkin Counties. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Minnesota...North Dakota... Red River of the North at Oslo affecting Grand Forks, Polk, Marshall and Walsh Counties. South Branch Buffalo River at Sabin affecting Clay County. Buffalo River near Dilworth affecting Clay County. Sheyenne River Diversion at West Fargo affecting Cass County. Sheyenne River at Harwood affecting Cass County. Maple River near Mapleton (South of I-94) affecting Cass County. Red River of the North at Pembina affecting Pembina and Kittson Counties. Red River of the North at Fargo affecting Cass and Clay Counties. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON TO LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Maple River near Mapleton (South of I-94). * WHEN...From Thursday afternoon to late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 20.0 feet, Flooding begins on high ground near gage. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:15 PM CDT Wednesday the stage was 16.5 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early tomorrow afternoon to a crest of 19.5 feet early Friday afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning. - Flood stage is 18.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Safety message - Turn around, don`t drown. Don`t travel through flooded areas. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
